018package org.tquadrat.foundation.util;
019
020import static java.lang.System.arraycopy;
021import static java.lang.System.getProperties;
022import static java.lang.System.getenv;
023import static java.util.regex.Pattern.compile;
024import static org.apiguardian.api.API.Status.INTERNAL;
025import static org.apiguardian.api.API.Status.STABLE;
026import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.nonNull;
027import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.requireNonNullArgument;
028import static org.tquadrat.foundation.util.StringUtils.format;
029import static org.tquadrat.foundation.util.StringUtils.isNotEmptyOrBlank;
030import static org.tquadrat.foundation.util.SystemUtils.determineIPAddress;
031import static org.tquadrat.foundation.util.SystemUtils.getMACAddress;
032import static org.tquadrat.foundation.util.SystemUtils.getNodeId;
033import static org.tquadrat.foundation.util.SystemUtils.getPID;
034
035import java.io.Serial;
036import java.io.Serializable;
037import java.net.SocketException;
038import java.time.Instant;
039import java.util.Collection;
040import java.util.HashMap;
041import java.util.HashSet;
042import java.util.Map;
043import java.util.Optional;
044import java.util.Set;
045import java.util.function.Function;
046import java.util.regex.Pattern;
047import java.util.regex.PatternSyntaxException;
048
049import org.apiguardian.api.API;
050import org.tquadrat.foundation.annotation.ClassVersion;
051import org.tquadrat.foundation.annotation.MountPoint;
052import org.tquadrat.foundation.exception.ImpossibleExceptionError;
053
054/**
055 *  <p>{@summary An instance of this class is basically a wrapper around a
056 *  String that contains placeholders (&quot;Variables&quot;) in the form
057 *  <code>${&lt;<i>name</i>&gt;}</code>, where &lt;<i>name</i> is the variable
058 *  name.}</p>
059 *  <p>The variables names are case-sensitive.</p>
060 *  <p>Valid variable names may not contain other characters than the letters
061 *  from 'a' to 'z' (upper case and lower case), the digits from '0' to '9' and
062 *  the special characters underscore ('_') and dot ('.'), after an optional
063 *  prefix character.</p>
064 *  <p>Allowed prefixes are the tilde ('~'), the slash ('/'), the equal sign
065 *  ('='), the colon (':'), the percent sign ('%'), and the ampersand
066 *  ('&amp;').</p>
067 *  <p>The prefix character is part of the name.</p>
068 *  <p>Finally, there is the single underscore that is allowed as a special
069 *  variable.</p>
070 *  <p>When the system data is added as source (see
071 *  {@link #replaceVariableFromSystemData(CharSequence, Map[]) replaceVariableFromSystemData()}
072 *  and
073 *  {@link #replaceVariable(boolean, Map[]) replaceVariable()}
074 *  with {@code addSystemData} set to {@code true}), some additional variables
075 *  are available:</p>
076 *  <dl>
077 *      <dt>{@value #VARNAME_IPAddress}</dt>
078 *      <dd>One of the outbound IP addresses of the machine that executes the
079 *      current program, if network is configured at all.</dd>
080 *      <dt>{@value #VARNAME_MACAddress}</dt>
081 *      <dd>The MAC address of the machine that executes the current program;
082 *      if no network is configured, a dummy address is used.</dd>
083 *      <dt>{@value #VARNAME_NodeId}</dt>
084 *      <dd>The node id of the machines that executes the current program; if
085 *      no network is configured, a pseudo node id is used.</dd>
086 *      <dt>{@value #VARNAME_Now}</dt>
087 *      <dd>The current data and time in UTC time zone.</dd>
088 *      <dt>{@value #VARNAME_pid}</dt>
089 *      <dd>The process id of the current program.</dd>
090 *  </dl>
091 *
092 *  @see #VARNAME_IPAddress
093 *  @see #VARNAME_MACAddress
094 *  @see #VARNAME_NodeId
095 *  @see #VARNAME_Now
096 *  @see #VARNAME_pid
097 *
098 *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
099 *  @version $Id: Template.java 1015 2022-02-09 08:25:36Z tquadrat $
100 *
101 *  @UMLGraph.link
102 *  @since 0.1.0
103 */
104@ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: Template.java 1015 2022-02-09 08:25:36Z tquadrat $" )
105@API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
106public class Template implements Serializable
107{
108        /*-----------*\
109    ====** Constants **========================================================
110        \*-----------*/
111    /**
112     *  The variable name for the IP address of the executing machine:
113     *  {@value}.
114     *
115     *  @since 0.1.0
116     */
117    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
118    public static final String VARNAME_IPAddress = "org.tquadrat.ipaddress";
119
120    /**
121     *  The variable name for the MAC address of the executing machine:
122     *  {@value}.
123     *
124     *  @since 0.1.0
125     */
126    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
127    public static final String VARNAME_MACAddress = "org.tquadrat.macaddress";
128
129    /**
130     *  The variable name for the node id of the executing machine: {@value}.
131     *
132     *  @since 0.1.0
133     */
134    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
135    public static final String VARNAME_NodeId = "org.tquadrat.nodeid";
136
137    /**
138     *  The variable name for the current date and time: {@value}.
139     *
140     * @see Instant#now()
141     *
142     *  @since 0.1.0
143     */
144    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
145    public static final String VARNAME_Now = "org.tquadrat.now";
146
147    /**
148     *  The variable name for the id of the current process, executing this
149     *  program: {@value}.
150     *
151     *  @since 0.1.0
152     */
153    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
154    public static final String VARNAME_pid = "org.tquadrat.pid";
155
156    /**
157     *  The regular expression to identify a variable in a char sequence:
158     *  {@value}.
159     *
160     *  @see #findVariables(CharSequence)
161     *  @see #findVariables()
162     *  @see #isValidVariableName(CharSequence)
163     *  @see #replaceVariable(CharSequence,Map...)
164     *  @see #replaceVariable(Map...)
165     *  @see #replaceVariable(CharSequence, Function)
166     *  @see #replaceVariable(Function)
167     *
168     *  @since 0.1.0
169     */
170    @SuppressWarnings( "RegExpUnnecessaryNonCapturingGroup" )
171    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
172    public static final String VARIABLE_PATTERN = "\\$\\{((?:_)|(?:[~/=%:&]?\\p{IsAlphabetic}(?:\\p{IsAlphabetic}|\\p{Digit}|_|.)*?))}";
173
174    /**
175     *  <p>{@summary The template for variables: {@value}.} The argument is the
176     *  name of the variable itself; after an optional prefix character, it may
177     *  not contain other characters than the letters from 'a' to 'z' (upper
178     *  case and lower case), the digits from '0' to '9' and the special
179     *  characters underscore ('_') and dot ('.').</p>
180     *  <p>Allowed prefixes are the tilde ('~'), the slash ('/'), the equal
181     *  sign ('='), the colon (':'), the percent sign ('%'), and the ampersand
182     *  ('&amp;').</p>
183     *  <p>The prefix character is part of the name.</p>
184     *  <p>Finally, there is the single underscore that is allowed as a
185     *  special variable.</p>
186     *
187     *  @see #VARIABLE_PATTERN
188     *
189     *  @since 0.1.0
190     */
191    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
192    public static final String VARIABLE_TEMPLATE = "${%1$s}";
193
194        /*------------*\
195    ====** Attributes **=======================================================
196        \*------------*/
197    /**
198     *  The template text.
199     */
200    private final String m_TemplateText;
201
202        /*------------------------*\
203    ====** Static Initialisations **===========================================
204        \*------------------------*/
205    /**
206     *  The pattern that is used to identify a variable in a char sequence.
207     *
208     *  @see #replaceVariable(CharSequence, Map...)
209     *  @see #replaceVariable(Map...)
210     *  @see #findVariables(CharSequence)
211     *  @see #findVariables()
212     *  @see #VARIABLE_PATTERN
213     */
214    private static final Pattern m_VariablePattern;
215
216    /**
217     *  The serial version UID for objects of this class: {@value}.
218     *
219     *  @hidden
220     */
221    @Serial
222    private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
223
224    static
225    {
226        //---* The regex patterns *--------------------------------------------
227        try
228        {
229            m_VariablePattern = compile( VARIABLE_PATTERN );
230        }
231        catch( final PatternSyntaxException e )
232        {
233            throw new ImpossibleExceptionError( "The patterns are constant values that have been tested", e );
234        }
235    }
236
237        /*--------------*\
238    ====** Constructors **=====================================================
239        \*--------------*/
240    /**
241     *  Creates a new instance of {@code Template}.
242     *
243     *  @param  templateText    The template text, containing variable in the
244     *      form <code>${&lt;<i>name</i>&gt;}</code>.
245     */
246    public Template( final CharSequence templateText )
247    {
248        m_TemplateText = requireNonNullArgument( templateText, "templateText" ).toString();
249    }   //  Template()
250
251        /*---------*\
252    ====** Methods **==========================================================
253        \*---------*/
254    /**
255     *  <p>{@summary The mount point for template manipulations in derived
256     *  classes.}</p>
257     *  <p>The default implementation will just return the argument.</p>
258     *
259     *  @param  templateText    The template text, as it was given to the
260     *      constructor on creation of the object instance.
261     *  @return The adjusted template text.
262     */
263    @SuppressWarnings( "static-method" )
264    @MountPoint
265    protected String adjustTemplate( final String templateText )
266    {
267        return templateText;
268    }   //  adjustTemplate()
269
270    /**
271     *  Builds the source map with the additional data.
272     *
273     *  @return The source map.
274     *
275     *  @see #VARNAME_IPAddress
276     *  @see #VARNAME_MACAddress
277     *  @see #VARNAME_NodeId
278     *  @see #VARNAME_Now
279     *  @see #VARNAME_pid
280     */
281    private static final Map<String,Object> createAdditionalSource()
282    {
283        final Map<String,Object> retValue = new HashMap<>(
284            Map.of( VARNAME_MACAddress, getMACAddress(), VARNAME_pid, Long.valueOf( getPID() ), VARNAME_NodeId, Long.valueOf( getNodeId() ), VARNAME_Now, Instant.now() )
285        );
286        try
287        {
288            determineIPAddress().ifPresent( i -> retValue.put( VARNAME_IPAddress, i ) );
289        }
290        catch( @SuppressWarnings( "unused" ) final SocketException e ) { /* Deliberately ignored */ }
291
292        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
293        return retValue;
294    }   //  createAdditionalSource()
295
296    /**
297     *  Escapes backslash ('\') and dollar sign ('$') for regex replacements.
298     *
299     *  @param  s   The source string.
300     *  @return The string with the escaped characters.
301     *
302     *  @see java.util.regex.Matcher#appendReplacement(StringBuffer,String)
303     *
304     *  @since 0.1.0
305     */
306    @API( status = INTERNAL, since = "0.1.0" )
307    private static String escapeRegexReplacement( final CharSequence s )
308    {
309        assert nonNull( s ) : "s is null";
310
311        //---* Escape the backslashes and dollar signs *-------------------
312        final var len = s.length();
313        final var retValue = new StringBuilder( (len * 12) / 10 );
314        @SuppressWarnings( "LocalVariableNamingConvention" )
315        char c;
316        EscapeLoop: for( var i = 0; i < len; ++i )
317        {
318            c = s.charAt( i );
319            switch( c )
320            {
321                case '\\':
322                case '$':
323                    retValue.append( '\\' ); // The fall through is intended here!
324                    //$FALL-THROUGH$
325                default: // Do nothing ...
326            }
327            retValue.append( c );
328        }   //  EscapeLoop:
329
330        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
331        return retValue.toString();
332    }   //  escapeRegexReplacement()
333
334    /**
335     *  <p>{@summary Collects all the variables of the form
336     *  <code>${<i>&lt;name&gt;</i>}</code> in the given String.}</p>
337     *  <p>If there are not any variables in the given String, an empty
338     *  {@link Set}
339     *  will be returned.</p>
340     *  <p>A valid variable name may not contain any other characters than the
341     *  letters from 'a' to 'z' (upper case and lower case), the digits from
342     *  '0' to '9' and the special characters underscore ('_') and dot ('.'),
343     *  after an optional prefix character.</p>
344     *  <p>Allowed prefixes are the tilde ('~'), the slash ('/'), the equal
345     *  sign ('='), the colon (':'), the percent sign ('%'), and the ampersand
346     *  ('&amp;').</p>
347     *  <p>Finally, there is the single underscore that is allowed as a
348     *  special variable.</p>
349     *
350     *  @param  text    The text with the variables; may be {@code null}.
351     *  @return A {@code Collection} with the variable (names).
352     *
353     *  @see #VARIABLE_PATTERN
354     *
355     *  @since 0.0.5
356     */
357    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
358    public static final Set<String> findVariables( final CharSequence text )
359    {
360        final Collection<String> buffer = new HashSet<>();
361        if( nonNull( text ) )
362        {
363            final var matcher = m_VariablePattern.matcher( text );
364            String found;
365            while( matcher.find() )
366            {
367                found = matcher.group( 1 );
368                buffer.add( found );
369            }
370        }
371        final var retValue = Set.copyOf( buffer );
372
373        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
374        return retValue;
375    }   //  findVariables()
376
377    /**
378     *  <p>{@summary Collects all the variables of the form
379     *  <code>${<i>&lt;name&gt;</i>}</code> in the adjusted template.}</p>
380     *  <p>If there are not any variables in there, an empty
381     *  {@link Collection}
382     *  will be returned.</p>
383     *  <p>A valid variable name may not contain any other characters than the
384     *  letters from 'a' to 'z' (upper case and lower case), the digits from
385     *  '0' to '9' and the special characters underscore ('_') and dot ('.'),
386     *  after an optional prefix character.</p>
387     *  <p>Allowed prefixes are the tilde ('~'), the slash ('/'), the equal
388     *  sign ('='), the colon (':'), the percent sign ('%'), and the ampersand
389     *  ('&amp;').</p>
390     *  <p>Finally, there is the single underscore that is allowed as a
391     *  special variable.</p>
392     *
393     *  @return A {@code Collection} with the variable (names).
394     *
395     *  @see #VARIABLE_PATTERN
396     */
397    public final Set<String> findVariables()
398    {
399        final var retValue = findVariables( getTemplateText() );
400
401        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
402        return retValue;
403    }   //  findVariables()
404
405    /**
406     *  <p>{@summary Mountpoint for the formatting of the result after the variables have
407     *  been replaced.}</p>
408     *  <p>The default implementation just returns the result.</p>
409     *
410     *  @param  text    The result from replacing the variables in the template
411     *      text.
412     *  @return The reformatted result.
413     */
414    @SuppressWarnings( "static-method" )
415    @MountPoint
416    protected String formatResult( final String text )
417    {
418        return text;
419    }   //  formatResult()
420
421    /**
422     *  Returns the template text after it has been processed by
423     *  {@link #adjustTemplate(String)}.
424     *
425     *  @return The adjusted template text.
426     */
427    protected final String getTemplateText() { return adjustTemplate( m_TemplateText ); }
428
429    /**
430     *  Checks whether the adjusted template contains the variable of
431     *  the form <code>${<i>&lt;name&gt;</i>}</code> (matching the pattern
432     *  given in
433     *  {@link #VARIABLE_PATTERN})
434     *  with the given name.
435     *
436     *  @param  name    The name of the variable to look for.
437     *  @return {@code true} if the template contains the variable,
438     *      {@code false} otherwise.
439     *  @throws IllegalArgumentException    The given argument is not valid as
440     *      a variable name.
441     *
442     *  @see #VARIABLE_PATTERN
443     */
444    public final boolean hasVariable( final String name )
445    {
446        if( !isValidVariableName( name ) ) throw new IllegalArgumentException( format( "%s is not a valid variable name", name ) );
447
448        final var retValue = findVariables().contains( name );
449
450        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
451        return retValue;
452    }   //  hasVariable()
453
454    /**
455     *  Checks whether the given String contains at least one variable of the
456     *  form <code>${<i>&lt;name&gt;</i>}</code> (matching the pattern given in
457     *  {@link #VARIABLE_PATTERN}).
458     *
459     *  @param  s   The String to test; can be {@code null}.
460     *  @return {@code true} if the String contains at least one variable,
461     *      {@code false} otherwise.
462     *
463     *  @see #VARIABLE_PATTERN
464     *
465     *  @since 0.1.0
466     */
467    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
468    public static final boolean hasVariables( final CharSequence s )
469    {
470        final var retValue = isNotEmptyOrBlank( s ) && m_VariablePattern.matcher( s ).find();
471
472        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
473        return retValue;
474    }   //  hasVariables()
475
476    /**
477     *  Checks whether the adjusted template contains at least one variable of
478     *  the form <code>${<i>&lt;name&gt;</i>}</code> (matching the pattern
479     *  given in
480     *  {@link #VARIABLE_PATTERN}).
481     *
482     *  @return {@code true} if the template contains at least one variable,
483     *      {@code false} otherwise.
484     *
485     *  @see #VARIABLE_PATTERN
486     */
487    public final boolean hasVariables() { return hasVariables( getTemplateText() ); }
488
489    /**
490     *  Test whether the given String is a valid variable name.
491     *
492     *  @param  name    The bare variable name, without the surrounding
493     *      &quot;${&hellip;}&quot;.
494     *  @return {@code true} if the given name is valid for a variable name,
495     *      {@code false} otherwise.
496     *
497     *  @see #VARIABLE_PATTERN
498     *  @see #findVariables(CharSequence)
499     *  @see #replaceVariable(CharSequence, Map...)
500     *
501     *  @since 0.1.0
502     */
503    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
504    public static final boolean isValidVariableName( final CharSequence name )
505    {
506        var retValue = isNotEmptyOrBlank( requireNonNullArgument( name, "name" ) );
507        if( retValue )
508        {
509            final var text = format( VARIABLE_TEMPLATE, name );
510            retValue = m_VariablePattern.matcher( text ).matches();
511        }
512
513        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
514        return retValue;
515    }   //  isValidVariableName()
516
517    /**
518     *  Checks whether the given String is a variable in the form
519     *  <code>${<i>&lt;name&gt;</i>}</code>, according to the pattern provided
520     *  in
521     *  {@link #VARIABLE_PATTERN}.
522     *
523     *  @param  s   The String to test; can be {@code null}.
524     *  @return {@code true} if the given String is not {@code null}, not the
525     *      empty String, and it matches the given pattern, {@code false}
526     *      otherwise.
527     *
528     *  @since 0.1.0
529     */
530    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
531    public static final boolean isVariable( final CharSequence s )
532    {
533        final var retValue = isNotEmptyOrBlank( s ) && m_VariablePattern.matcher( s ).matches();
534
535        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
536        return retValue;
537    }   //  isVariable()
538
539    /**
540     *  <p>{@summary Replaces the variables of the form
541     *  <code>${&lt;<i>name</i>&gt;}</code> in the given String with values
542     *  from the given maps.} The method will try the maps in the given
543     *  sequence, it stops after the first match.</p>
544     *  <p>If no replacement value could be found, the variable will not be
545     *  replaced at all.</p>
546     *  <p>If a value from one of the maps contains a variable itself, this
547     *  will not be replaced.</p>
548     *  <p>The variables names are case-sensitive.</p>
549     *  <p>Valid variable names may not contain other characters than the
550     *  letters from 'a' to 'z' (upper case and lower case), the digits from
551     *  '0' to '9' and the special characters underscore ('_') and dot ('.'),
552     *  after an optional prefix character.</p>
553     *  <p>Allowed prefixes are the tilde ('~'), the slash ('/'), the equal
554     *  sign ('='), the colon (':'), the percent sign ('%'), and the ampersand
555     *  ('&amp;').</p>
556     *  <p>The prefix character is part of the name.</p>
557     *  <p>Finally, there is the single underscore that is allowed as a
558     *  special variable.</p>
559     *
560     *  @param  text    The text with the variables; may be {@code null}.
561     *  @param  sources The maps with the replacement values.
562     *  @return The new text, or {@code null} if the provided value for
563     *      {@code text} was already {@code null}.
564     *
565     *  @see #VARIABLE_PATTERN
566     *
567     *  @since 0.1.0
568     */
569    @SafeVarargs
570    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
571    public static final String replaceVariable( final CharSequence text, final Map<String,? extends Object>... sources )
572    {
573        requireNonNullArgument( sources, "sources" );
574
575        final var retValue = replaceVariable( text, variable -> retrieveVariableValue( variable, sources ) );
576
577        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
578        return retValue;
579    }   //  replaceVariable()
580
581    /**
582     *  <p>{@summary Replaces the variables of the form
583     *  <code>${&lt;<i>name</i>&gt;}</code> in the adjusted template with
584     *  values from the given maps and returns it after formatting the result.}
585     *  The method will try the maps in the given sequence, it stops after the
586     *  first match.</p>
587     *  <p>If no replacement value could be found, the variable will not be
588     *  replaced at all.</p>
589     *  <p>If a value from one of the maps contains a variable itself, this
590     *  will not be replaced.</p>
591     *  <p>The variables names are case-sensitive.</p>
592     *  <p>Valid variable names may not contain other characters than the
593     *  letters from 'a' to 'z' (upper case and lower case), the digits from
594     *  '0' to '9' and the special characters underscore ('_') and dot ('.'),
595     *  after an optional prefix character.</p>
596     *  <p>Allowed prefixes are the tilde ('~'), the slash ('/'), the equal
597     *  sign ('='), the colon (':'), the percent sign ('%'), and the ampersand
598     *  ('&amp;').</p>
599     *  <p>The prefix character is part of the name.</p>
600     *  <p>Finally, there is the single underscore that is allowed as a
601     *  special variable.</p>
602     *
603     *  @param  sources The maps with the replacement values.
604     *  @return The new text, or {@code null} if the provided value for
605     *      {@code text} was already {@code null}.
606     *
607     *  @see #VARIABLE_PATTERN
608     */
609    @SafeVarargs
610    public final String replaceVariable( final Map<String,? extends Object>... sources )
611    {
612        return replaceVariable( false, sources );
613    }   //  replaceVariable()
614
615    /**
616     *  <p>{@summary Replaces the variables of the form
617     *  <code>${&lt;<i>name</i>&gt;}</code> in the adjusted template with
618     *  values from the given maps and returns it after formatting the result.}
619     *  The method will try the maps in the given sequence, it stops after the
620     *  first match.</p>
621     *  <p>If {@code addSystemData} is provided as {@code true}, the
622     *  {@linkplain System#getProperties() system properties}
623     *  and
624     *  {@linkplain System#getenv()} system environment}
625     *  will be searched for replacement values before any other source.</p>
626     *  <p>If no replacement value could be found, the variable will not be
627     *  replaced at all.</p>
628     *  <p>If a value from one of the maps contains a variable itself, this
629     *  will not be replaced.</p>
630     *  <p>The variables names are case-sensitive.</p>
631     *  <p>Valid variable names may not contain other characters than the
632     *  letters from 'a' to 'z' (upper case and lower case), the digits from
633     *  '0' to '9' and the special characters underscore ('_') and dot ('.'),
634     *  after an optional prefix character.</p>
635     *  <p>Allowed prefixes are the tilde ('~'), the slash ('/'), the equal
636     *  sign ('='), the colon (':'), the percent sign ('%'), and the ampersand
637     *  ('&amp;').</p>
638     *  <p>The prefix character is part of the name.</p>
639     *  <p>Finally, there is the single underscore that is allowed as a
640     *  special variable.</p>
641     *
642     *  @param  addSystemData   {@code true} if the system properties and the
643     *      system environment should be searched for replacement values, too,
644     *      otherwise {@code false}.
645     *  @param  sources The maps with the replacement values.
646     *  @return The new text, or {@code null} if the provided value for
647     *      {@code text} was already {@code null}.
648     *
649     *  @see #VARIABLE_PATTERN
650     *  @see #replaceVariableFromSystemData(CharSequence, Map[])
651     */
652    @SafeVarargs
653    public final String replaceVariable( final boolean addSystemData, final Map<String,? extends Object>... sources )
654    {
655        final var rawTemplate = getTemplateText();
656        final var processedText = addSystemData
657            ? replaceVariableFromSystemData( rawTemplate, sources )
658            : replaceVariable( rawTemplate, sources );
659        final var retValue = formatResult( processedText );
660
661        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
662        return retValue;
663    }   //  replaceVariable()
664
665    /**
666     *  <p>{@summary Replaces the variables of the form
667     *  <code>${&lt;<i>name</i>&gt;}</code> in the adjusted template with
668     *  values returned by the given retriever function for the variable name,
669     *  and returns it after formatting the result.}</p>
670     *  <p>If no replacement value could be found, the variable will not be
671     *  replaced at all.</p>
672     *  <p>If the retriever function returns a value that contains a variable
673     *  itself, this will not be replaced.</p>
674     *  <p>The retriever function will be called only once for each variable
675     *  name; if the text contains the same variable multiple times, it will
676     *  always be replaced with the same value.</p>
677     *  <p>The variables names are case-sensitive.</p>
678     *  <p>Valid variable names may not contain other characters than the
679     *  letters from 'a' to 'z' (upper case and lower case), the digits from
680     *  '0' to '9' and the special characters underscore ('_') and dot ('.'),
681     *  after an optional prefix character.</p>
682     *  <p>Allowed prefixes are the tilde ('~'), the slash ('/'), the equal
683     *  sign ('='), the colon (':'), the percent sign ('%'), and the ampersand
684     *  ('&amp;').</p>
685     *  <p>The prefix character is part of the name.</p>
686     *  <p>Finally, there is the single underscore that is allowed as a
687     *  special variable.</p>
688     *
689     *  @param  retriever   The function that will retrieve the replacement
690     *      values for the given variable names.
691     *  @return The new text, or {@code null} if the provided value for
692     *      {@code text} was already {@code null}.
693     *
694     *  @see #VARIABLE_PATTERN
695     */
696    public final String replaceVariable( final Function<? super String, Optional<String>> retriever )
697    {
698        final var retValue = formatResult( replaceVariable( getTemplateText(), retriever ) );
699
700        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
701        return retValue;
702    }   //  replaceVariable()
703
704    /**
705     *  <p>{@summary Replaces the variables of the form
706     *  <code>${&lt;<i>name</i>&gt;}</code> in the given String with values
707     *  returned by the given retriever function for the variable name.}</p>
708     *  <p>If no replacement value could be found, the variable will not be
709     *  replaced at all.</p>
710     *  <p>If the retriever function returns a value that contains a variable
711     *  itself, this will not be replaced.</p>
712     *  <p>The retriever function will be called only once for each variable
713     *  name; if the text contains the same variable multiple times, it will
714     *  always be replaced with the same value.</p>
715     *  <p>The variables names are case-sensitive.</p>
716     *  <p>Valid variable name may not contain other characters than the
717     *  letters from 'a' to 'z' (upper case and lower case), the digits from
718     *  '0' to '9' and the special characters underscore ('_') and dot ('.'),
719     *  after an optional prefix character.</p>
720     *  <p>Allowed prefixes are the tilde ('~'), the slash ('/'), the equal
721     *  sign ('='), the colon (':'), the percent sign ('%'), and the ampersand
722     *  ('&amp;').</p>
723     *  <p>The prefix character is part of the name.</p>
724     *  <p>Finally, there is the single underscore that is allowed as a
725     *  special variable.</p>
726     *
727     *  @param  text    The text with the variables; may be {@code null}.
728     *  @param  retriever   The function that will retrieve the replacement
729     *      values for the given variable names.
730     *  @return The new text, or {@code null} if the provided value for
731     *      {@code text} was already {@code null}.
732     *
733     *  @see #VARIABLE_PATTERN
734     *
735     *  @since 0.1.0
736     */
737    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
738    public static final String replaceVariable( final CharSequence text, final Function<? super String, Optional<String>> retriever )
739    {
740        requireNonNullArgument( retriever, "retriever" );
741
742        final Map<String,String> cache = new HashMap<>();
743
744        String retValue = null;
745        if( nonNull( text ) )
746        {
747            final var matcher = m_VariablePattern.matcher( text );
748            final var buffer = new StringBuilder();
749            while( matcher.find() )
750            {
751                final var variable = matcher.group( 0 );
752                final var replacement = cache.computeIfAbsent( variable, v -> escapeRegexReplacement( retriever.apply( matcher.group( 1 ) ).orElse( v ) ) );
753                matcher.appendReplacement( buffer, replacement );
754            }
755            matcher.appendTail( buffer );
756            retValue = buffer.toString();
757        }
758
759        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
760        return retValue;
761    }   //  replaceVariable()
762
763    /**
764     *  <p>{@summary Replaces the variables of the form
765     *  <code>${<i>&lt;name&gt;</i>}</code> in the given String with values
766     *  from the
767     *  {@linkplain System#getProperties() system properties},
768     *  the
769     *  {@linkplain System#getenv() system environment}
770     *  and the given maps.} The method will try the maps in the given
771     *  sequence, it stops after the first match.</p>
772     *  <p>In addition, five more variables are recognised:</p>
773     *  <dl>
774     *      <dt><b><code>{@value #VARNAME_IPAddress}</code></b></dt>
775     *      <dd>The first IP address for the machine that executes this Java
776     *      virtual machine.</dd>
777     *      <dt><b><code>{@value #VARNAME_MACAddress}</code></b></dt>
778     *      <dd>The MAC address of the first NIC in this machine.</dd>
779     *      <dt><b><code>{@value #VARNAME_NodeId}</code></b></dt>
780     *      <dd>The node id from the first NIC in this machine.</dd>
781     *      <dt><b><code>{@value #VARNAME_Now}</code></b></dt>
782     *      <dd>The current date and time as returned by
783     *      {@link Instant#now}.</dd>
784     *      <dt><b><code>{@value #VARNAME_pid}</code></b></dt>
785     *      <dd>The process id of this Java virtual machine.</dd>
786     *  </dl>
787     *  <p>If no replacement value could be found, the variable will not be
788     *  replaced at all; no exception will be thrown.</p>
789     *  <p>If a value from one of the maps contains a variable itself, this
790     *  will not be replaced.</p>
791     *  <p>The variables names are case-sensitive.</p>
792     *
793     *  @param  text    The text with the variables; can be {@code null}.
794     *  @param  additionalSources The maps with additional replacement values.
795     *  @return The new text, or {@code null} if the provided value for
796     *      {@code text} was already {@code null}.
797     *
798     *  @see #VARIABLE_PATTERN
799     *  @see #replaceVariable(CharSequence, Map...)
800     */
801    @SafeVarargs
802    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
803    public static final String replaceVariableFromSystemData( final CharSequence text, final Map<String,? extends Object>... additionalSources )
804    {
805        final var currentLen = requireNonNullArgument( additionalSources, "additionalSources" ).length;
806        final var newLen = currentLen + 3;
807        @SuppressWarnings( "unchecked" )
808        final Map<String,? extends Object> [] sources =  new Map [newLen];
809        if( currentLen > 0 )
810        {
811            arraycopy( additionalSources, 0, sources, 3, currentLen );
812        }
813
814        @SuppressWarnings( {"unchecked", "rawtypes"} )
815        final Map<String,? extends Object> systemProperties = (Map) getProperties();
816
817        sources [0] = createAdditionalSource();
818        sources [1] = systemProperties;
819        sources [2] = getenv();
820
821        final var retValue = replaceVariable( text, sources );
822
823        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
824        return retValue;
825    }   //  replaceVariableFromSystemData()
826
827    /**
828     *  Tries to obtain a value for the given key from one of the given
829     *  sources that will be searched in the given sequence order.
830     *
831     *  @param  name    The name of the value.
832     *  @param  sources The maps with the values.
833     *  @return An instance of
834     *      {@link Optional}
835     *      that holds the value from one of the sources.
836     */
837    @SafeVarargs
838    private static final Optional<String> retrieveVariableValue( final String name, final Map<String,? extends Object>... sources )
839    {
840        assert nonNull( name ) : "name is null";
841        assert nonNull( sources ) : "sources is null";
842
843        Optional<String> retValue = Optional.empty();
844
845        //---* Search the sources *--------------------------------------------
846        Object value = null;
847        SearchLoop: for( final var map : sources )
848        {
849            value = map.get( name );
850            if( nonNull( value ) ) break SearchLoop;
851        }   //  SearchLoop:
852
853        if( nonNull( value ) )
854        {
855            //---* Escape the backslashes and dollar signs *-------------------
856            retValue = Optional.of( value.toString() );
857        }
858
859        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
860        return retValue;
861    }   //  retrieveVariableValue()
862}
863//  class Template
864
865/*
866 *  End of File
867 */
